remarks: A metric ` D ` is complete iff all Cauchy sequences converge to a point in the space.  The proof uses countable choice.  Part of Definition 1.4-3 of [Kreyszig] p. 28.  (Contributed by NM, 7-Sep-2006.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.)
statement:
iscmet2.1 $e |- J = ( MetOpen ` D ) $.
iscmet2 $p |- ( D e. ( CMet ` X ) <-> ( D e. ( Met ` X ) /\ ( Cau ` D ) C_ dom ( ~~>t ` J ) ) ) $.
